snippet: Stocks were mixed Monday on Wall Street as weekend election results in Greece and France added to the uncertainty created by last week’s disappointing jobs data in the United States.
abstract: Stocks are mixed as election results in Greece and France add to the uncertainty created by disappointing jobs data in the United States. Graphs, Photo (M)

byline.original: By CHRISTINE HAUSER; David Jolly and Bettina Wassener contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: Election results in Europe injected new uncertainty into financial markets on Monday, but stocks on Wall Street generally rode out the political developments with little change. Weekend voting in Greece and France followed a disappointing jobs report on Friday in the United States and the worst weekly declines on Wall Street this year.

headline.main: Markets Change Little After Political Shake-Up in Europe
